intro: Drymaria pratheri, commonly known as the Prather's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
